Tuoksussa vahvimpana on raikas sitruksisuus ja hieman mentholmaisuuteen vivahtava havuisuus. Mallaspohja tuntuu hieman karamellisena, muttei kuitenkaan √§lytt√∂m√§n makeana. Suoraviivainen, mutta toimiva tuoksu. Maussa vanhuus jo tuntuu, makea karamellia nousee enemm√§n esiin, havuinen ja makean sitruksinen hedelm√§ nousee esiin liev√§n mentholisuuden kanssa. Jonkinlaista yrttist√§ tupakkamaisuuttakin on jonkin verran. Suutuntuma on keskit√§ytel√§inen, hieman makea, katkerot iskev√§t lopussa melko kovasti. Hieman erilainen DIPA, mekko suoraviivainen, mutta katkerot ovat s√§ilyneet melko hyvin. Makeus ei vaivaa, humalointi on iskev√§√§ ja juotavuus pelottavan hyv√§.
0,33l can. Pours dark red with medium sized white head. Syrup, pine, caramel malts. Good one!

Klirrend kupferlastig und overdosed gehopft. Maximaler CitrusRedDIPA Spass mit solide schlankem Malzbody. Deutlich mehr Dampf als gedacht. ASA Randerscheinung üòä. The Metal Spicey Amber Ale ‚õì . 355ml CAN from BBHH. 5¬Ä!?

A dark red-brown beer, a head is big and beige. Aroma has caramel, mandarin, pine, tropical fruitness. Rich. Taste has caramel malts, citrus, pine and wood. Lots of caramel, but also enough of bitterness, thus balanced. Bitterness in the end. Medium+ bodied. Strong caramel but still nicely balanced. Very tasteful.

Can. Darker amber in color with an off-white head. Sweet syrupy notes, overripe fruits and caramel in aroma. Smooth mouthfeel. Bittersweet taste. Toffee and boozy notes. Ripe fruity and mouthdrying bitter finish. But hey, the drinkability is really good here, nice one.

Clear, brown mahogany colour and a creamy tan head. Fresh aroma, plenty piney, hoppy. Watery taste at first, builds up a lot towards the finish. Rich malty taste, light bitterness. Slick, oily mouthfeel, medium body, light carbonation. Very nice.
Pours a dark and hazy red, with dark white head. Aroma is rich and hoppy. Taste is complex with lots of hop action. This is a very nice IPA, thumbs up!
Draft at Growler USA. Orange brown with medium body. Aroma of citrus and pine, taste is nice balance of malt and citrus upfront. Finishes medium bitter.
Purvis Cellars can (15-May-17) Sweet berry pine aroma. Red, ok head and sheet lace. Sweet berry herbal flavour. Bitter berry spirit finish and berry spice aftertaste.

Spice herbal hop aroma. Deep Amber colour poor head and lacing. Malt caramel spice chocolate flavour. Smooth palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep ruby red, light brown, clear, offering a frothy off white head with good lacings. Aromas of caramelised hay and pine develops, sweet mushy bread notes and dark fruit adds to the complexity. Fine carbonation, smooth and slick with a pronounced sweetness upfront offering a nice bitter hit at the back of the palate making it a very drinkable beer. Lasting light sticky yet pleasant finish.

Can at home. Hazy dark amber with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Very present bitterness with subtle fruity sweetness. Pine, caramel, citrus, red fruits and malts. Very good.
Pours light amber with an off-white head. Tastes of malt, bitter hops & alcohol with a bitter alcohol finish.
Tap at J¬ís. Pours a clear amber with a finger of foam that lingers. Caramel, pine and light gummy bear nose. A little syrupy mouthfeel. Balanced sweet & dry. Dry finish w/ some bitterness.
Amber colour with thin soapy head. Aroma and flavour have a nice balance of sweet and bitter. Hints of caramel malts and floral hops.

Can 355ml, a clear copper beer with low head. Nose is intense in hop resin and coconut oil, caramel, sugar. Aroma is intense on hop resin, pine,mango, coconut oil, robust body quite sweet, more a dipa than an apa. Anyway good and strong but clearly overrated.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2017 Bue √† la pression. Couleur rouge rubis intense, limpide, c?est beau ! Mousse cr√©meuse qui ne tr√©passe pas, nez caramel et houblons un peu r√©sineux. Bonne rondeur en bouche, dominante de caramel avec ce qu?il faut d?√©pices. R√©glisse et toffee en fin de bouche, et un chou√Øa de cerise/framboise quand elle est encore bien fraiche. Top de chez top !
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2017 355ml can. Pours orange brown. Toffee, biscuit, aniseed, orange, grapefruit. Long bitter finish. Full sticky body. Delightful.

355 ml can. Amber color with thick creamy head, good lookin. Elegant strong smell, full hoppy with pepper in the end. Also some almonds. Good taste, full. Alcohol tasting, but in a good way. frutiy, gets better with every taste.

This has been a favorite of mine for years and thankfully, continues to earn that distinction. It pours a nice think malty red and the nose is a sticky mess of gooey hawaiian punch sweets and malty hoppy gnarl. The taste is total lick smacking red ale hop loveliness, round and smooth and bitter and refreshing. The 8.7% is present but still fairly hidden all things considered. A real treat for red ale fans and hop heads alike! One of my all time favorites and one I revisit regularly. Good for kicking off a mediocre Wrestlemania card all by yourself while you await the late night return of your superior 50%.

√Åmbar oscuro con media corona de espuma, aromas a resina, l√∫pulo, maracuy√°, papaya, caramelo y flores; en boca entrada potente, maltosa, fuerte carga de maltas caramelo, amargor medio, con final de trago dulce; cuerpo medio pleno con ajustada carbonataci√≥n, alcohol bien integrado, notas a caramelo y frutas tropicales, m√°s ibus de amargor le vendr√≠a bien, por lo dem√°s excelente cerveza.

Hazy amber to copper body with a beige, long-lived head that sticks to the glass. Strong aroma of caramel, red berries, generic fruits with hints of tropical fruits, and pine, upon a spicy and peppery background. Strong flavour of sweet caramel, dark caramel, slightly overripe tropical fruits, red berries and roasted malt. Moderate sweet taste with a pretty heavy bitter and pleasantly long-lasting finish. Medium body, creamy texture, rather soft carbonation. A really nice one indeed! 
[35.5 cl can @ Nydalen Bryggeri og Spiseri, Oslo]

Served from can into glass at home. Pours amber brown in color red around the edges, low clarity, with creamy off white head. Sticky, fruity aroma with resinous hops. Intense dank hop flavor with more fruity notes, balanced by caramel maltiness. Medium bitterness and a fairly high sweetness. Full body with low carbonation. Slight alcohol flavor is present. Overall this is a full flavored dankly hoppy red colored beer with the body of an imperial. Easily drinkable and very enjoyable.

35,5cl Can @ 2D2Dspuma Tienda, Barcelona, Spain.
Hazy amber colour with a thick white head.
Aroma is caramel, bread, resin, hops, citrus, grapefruit.
Taste is hops, caramel, malt, pine, citrus, toffee.
Medium to full body, moderate carbonation.
outstanding. Brilliant aroma, gorgeous looks, and what taste and mouthfeel and everything. Soft mellow bitterness lingering around, lip smacking. G¬íLorious!

DOC: 2/14/20172015 BJCP Category: 21B Specialty IPA - Red IPA
AROMA: Strong fruity hop aroma, especially of berry and citrus. Some piney notes as well. Low amber malt sweetness. 10/12APPEARANCE: Reddish copper/amber. Clear. Large off white soapy foam retains and laces very well. 3/3FLAVOR: Well-balanced palette of equal parts malty sweetness and dank hop bitterness and flavor. Base has a caramel/toffee-like taste not unlike an amber ale. Bitterness is dank rather than dry. Hops create light fruity notes on the first half (berry and citrus) followed by piney/resiny/smokey notes on the backend. Light clean alcohol flavor is not distracting. Slight residual sweetness and some drying bitterness make for a fine aftertaste. 17/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium body and carbonation. Texture is fairly soft, but not chewy or velvety. Finishes smooth. Seems a little lighter than 8.7% ABV. Minor alcohol warmth. Would be ideal on nitro. 4/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: Has all the best features of ambers, strong ales and IPAs. A fun and interesting beer to drink. 9/10TOTAL SCORE: 43/50

Pours a red head with strong red pepper aromas. Amber to ruby colored body. In mouth a big load of hops, fruit and medium malts. Round and a bit spicy for an IIPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Boks p√• Agenturet. Aroma humle, sitrus, appelsin. Utseende uklar gylden med offwhite skum. Sitrus, appelsin, humle. En kraftig og god √∏l med mye smak

Nez : un petit c√¥t√© malt√©, un fond √©thylique mais qui soutiennent des houblons assez pr√©sents et puissants.
Ils le sont surtout en bouche : orange tr√®s am√®re, du r√©sineux, beaucoup de r√©sineux. Finale tr√®s am√®re et s√®che mais √©galement assez √©thylique. Bien √©quilibr√©e.
Stone fruit and citrus aroma. Clear orange red Amber with an off white head that leaves tons of lacing. Resiny. Syrupy sweet. Cherries. Citrus. Smooth. Medium bodied. Clean finish.
Can @ skip, Helsingborg. Pours a amber colour beer with a small head. Fruity and hoppy with caramel and notes of pine. Dry finish.

Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2010 (Day 3), Earl¬ís Court, London Aug 2010 - 
As "Oskar Blues Gordon" - Reddish Amber in colour. Very hoppy; oily resinous hops. Fruity; citrus grapefruit and lemon. Malty; sweet malts, caramel. Very good hop/fruit/malt balance. Lots of hops and sweet malts. Very drinkable. Nice DIPA or IAA! (2010-08)
Some citrus and a little malt. Pours amber with good head and lacing. Good balance and pretty easy drinking for booze level. Tap at Churchkey.

12oz can, slight hazy amber-red hue, with a thick beige head, nice fruity herbal citrus, leafy, grassy hoppy, mild tea, tobacco leaf nose, with some sweet toasted, bready, leafy, grassy hoppy, toasted breadcrumb, subtle lemon rind, faint mint leaf accents, and a faint toasted pie crust, candied grapefruit peel, subtle lemon marmalade, lemon candyish lollipop note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth spritzy spicy flowery citrus, leafy, grassy, minty hoppy character with some earthy lemon tea, tobacco leaf, mild grainy earthy toasted, caramel, pale malty, mint leaf, spritzy candied lemon, grapefruit peel, subtle lemon marmalade, subtle cedary flavours, leading towards fruity zesty candied lemon, grapefruit peel, earthy lemon tea leaf, lingering sweet earthy citrus, leafy, grassy, cedary hop bitterness finish.
Boks 335ml p√• Agenturet. Amber. Filmskum. God plommearoma med spor av krydder. Balansert. Smaken rikt fruktig. Aprikos & fersken. Utmerket √∏l!
B√§rnstensf√§rgad mot orange √∂l med ett smutsvitt kvarstannande skum. Doft av malt, karamell, citrus och tallbarr. Detsamma √•terkommer i smaken.

Couleur acajou transparente, avec de fine bulle remontant √† la surface. Une mousse pleine et beige qui perdure. Un nez foutrement sucr√© et malt√© cot√© caramel et bien vanill√©. Des notes de houblons citronn√© viennent agr√©ment√© le tout.

D√®s l¬íentr√©e en bouche, c¬íest merveilleux. Un malt doux caramel, mais extr√™mement go√ªteux vient ouvrir les sens avec un petit up de citron. Un petit sucre brun et le bon malt caramel fait oubli√© imm√©diatement ce petit cot√© citronn√© pour laisser place √† la r√©sine de pin et quelque petit fruit tropicaux en arri√®re plan. L¬íamertume est ancr√© sur des notes cuivr√©s et de malt caramel. Excellente, Cheers!

Can from LCBO. This 4-pack winked at me the last time I was at the LCBO. It was a day or two after New Years & I was feeling less than fresh & the thought of a IIPA/strong ale (this beer could & should be classified as either) 4-pack seemed daunting. Along comes a crappy week at the education factory & (more importantly) payday & this beauty is in my fridge. Nice clash of rich malt & generous dry hops. Cut some of the sugars & this would probably punch its way into a 4.0+ rating.

355 ml can from LCBO. Pours a clear mahogany colour with moderate-sized cream-coloured head. Aroma is rich toffee, bread, citric hops and dried fruit. Flavour is big toffee, gently toasty bread, dark dried fruit and some citrusy and slightly piney hops. Average-full body. Nice.

It pours amber with copper highlights; the head is off white and foamy. The aroma has notes of: toffee, grapefruit zest, freshly cut grass, mangos, and strawberry jam. The taste is medium bitter. The palate is medium-heavy bodied with medium carbonation, and has a long finish. Overall, it has a very unique profile.

Cor √¢mbar com tonalidade rubi, turva com algum brilho e um pouco de perlage; espuma marfim de tonalidade amarelada formando bela cascata quando vertida; alta forma√ß√£o e m√©dia/alta persist√™ncia com lacing regular.
Aroma com perfeito equil√≠brio da base maltada de caramelo (um pouco a√ßucarado mas agrad√°vel) e muito l√∫pulo c√≠trico (muita toranja e leves abacaxi e manga), al√©m de leve √°lcool lembrando madeira.
Sabor inicial de caramelo evoluindo para meio alco√≥lico e c√≠trico (vide aroma), aumentando de intensidade at√© o final; retrogosto alco√≥lico, amargo e um pouco amadeirado.
Corpo sedoso com espuma cremosa na boca nos primeiros goles e baixa carbonata√ß√£o.
Um show de equil√≠brio e alta drinkabilty, ainda mais para uma cerveja com 8,7% ABV.

√Çmbar avermelhado de leve turbidez, espuma bege avermelhado de media forma√ß√£o e persist√™ncia. Aroma mistura caramelo com uva vermelha, adocicado, cereja. Paladar de m√©dio dul√ßor e leve amargor lupulado. Corpo e carbonata√ß√£o m√©dios. Final de m√©dia/longa persist√™ncia tendendo a fruta vermelha e suco de l√∫pulo. Muito boa.

2016/12/09 - Pours a clear, deep amber colour with a thick, frothy, cream coloured head that slowly reduces and leaves moderate, sticky lacing. Aroma is caramel, sweet bread, brown sugar, earthy notes, resin, citrus (grapefruit, orange) and a hint of pineapple. Taste is caramel, orange, sweet bread resin, more earthy hops and a hint of booze. Moderately bitter and moderate to high sweetness. Mouthfeel is full and sticky with smooth carbonation and a dry, bittersweet finish. Incredibly smooth and well balanced for a beer of this ABV.

A rich reddy amber body with a dense beige head. The nose is an engaging mix of big, fresh resinous hops, brown sugar and malt. A really tasty malt forward imperial ipa. Rich caramel, chewy biscuit malt and cereal form the backbone. Grapefruit, orange and pine resin lead an impressive hop profile. Coats the mouth with sweetness. A dense, slick body.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2017 I am surprised I have not reviewed this beer before. Beautiful pour, ruby red with a tan colored abundant foamy head. Smells resiny, herbal and like a wet first rain in spring. First taste is amazing, it fills the mouth very well balanced, even though alcohol is not evidently present. Great beer.

Pours a slightly hazy, almost clean amber color with medium beige head. Aroma has pine, citrus and bread, with a fair amount of caramel and resin. Taste follows the nose, citrus hops, pine drops, caramel/toffee, bread, tropical fruits and resin. Moderate bitter aftertaste.

355ml can from LCBO. Pours an insane amount of foamy, bubbly beige head and has a fairly clear amber coppery appearance. Nice thick dirty lacing. Aromas of toasty malts, hints of caramel as well as resin and earthy hops. Flavours are sweet and malty, some caramel also makes a strong appearance. Some earthy hop notes. Has a little bit of a rusty metallic like finish, does not detract or lessen from main flavour notes. Good retention. Medium bodied mouthfeel.

Pours dark amber with an off white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, citrus fruits and hops. Sweet malts, carmel, mixed with citrus and tropical fruit flavours. It has a good bitter kick with a sweet finish. Excellent beer.

Dor√©e rouge orange, cette am√©ricaine limpide manifeste son patriotisme de suite : houblons bleus blancs rouges fruit√©s et herbeux, avec un peu de sucre d¬íorge. Les saveurs sont sur la m√™me page, avec une importante amertume aux ananas, bien soutenue par une √©paisse et collante vague de malts caramel qui lui donne des airs d¬íIrish Red. Tr√®s agr√©able, bien balanc√©e et, bien qu¬íun peu convenue, terriblement efficace.

Cannette. Couleur ambr√©e-rousse. Mousse beige. Ar√¥me de c√©r√©ale, caramel et houblon. En bouche, assez ronde, notes de malt caramel, plein de houblon, finale amertume moyenne et malt. Assez corpulente mais agr√©able et chaleureuse !

Can from the LCBO. Hazy medium copper under a long lasting off white head that leaves lots of lace. Nose is resin, tropical fruit and a good dose of caramel. Flavour is medium sweet with a balancing bitterness and a touch of pepper. Mouth is medium and sticky with average carbonation and a chewy fruity finish. Nice

8/4/8-/4-/15

355ml can. Pours a slightly hazy reddish amber with a frothy beige head. On the nose, resinous notes, passion fruit, grapefruit, various other notes from the tropical fruit family, and caramel. Taste-wise, sweet with tonnes of fruit-forward notes, tropical fruit, burnt sugar, lighter notes of resinous hops, and faint woody malt notes that lead into more sweet malt, mineral bitterness, and lots of fruit and more of the light woody malt in the finish. It¬ís a little too sweet, but everything else is so damn good that it¬ís easy to forget. This is VERY good stuff.

Can; pours clear amber with a khaki colored head; aroma of pine, malt, and hints of caramel and bread; taste is a little bitter with pine, caramel, and a little biscuit; finish is light bitter with some pine notes
12oz can. Cloudy copper with a foamy beige head. Flavors are caramel, toasted cereals, pine resin, citrus and brown sugar with syrupy notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.

Can, BrewDog online. Deep reddish brown colour, bright, white foam. Nice strong red, quite sweet caramelly malt with a nice fruity citrus orange hop bitterness. Modest pine. Not overly bitter - bittersweet. Drinks nicely for abv. Good stuff.

From a small can 6 pack bought at Central City liquor store at Surrey Place. A dark amber beer with generous frothy white head and fruity nose. Moderately bitter with big citrus-fruity flavors, and strong malt background. Nicely balanced. Delicious! 4

Can pour into nonic pint glass from Greg & Jane¬ís Beer and Wine. Appearance is hazy reddish-brown with tons of sparkle, 1.5-finger width foamy beige head with great retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is solid caramel malt backbone with yeasty dough and danky resin. Taste is caramel malts with danky hops, late fruit, citrus and bitter. Palate is medium-to-full bodied with slightly sticky texture, average carbonation and mix of sweet and bitter finish. Overall, the caramel malt mix with danky resin almost tastes incomplete or past-its-prime--there¬ís something just a little bit off for me.
4-pack of cans from LCBO. Great fruity, grainy, caramel aroma. Same notes in the taste. Smooth at the start, bitter finish. Very tasty.
can from a buddy down the streat. pours amber, creamy off white head toast, caramel, bitterness, resin, and pine. medium body.

Can thoughtfully aged a couple months by your good friends at the lcbo. Red pour, smaller white head, consistent ring of lace. Bitter aroma, nuts, resinous hops still somewhat prominent, blood orange, caramel, brown sugar, malty. Lighter resinous hops give way to caramel malt, brown sugar, toffee, faint tangerine notes fighting through the finish. Resin-sticky mouthfeel. Even after the unwarranted aging still worthwhile.

Looks like one of those copper desert sunsets in the glass. Sticky toffee, ripe grapefruit and brown sugar on the nose. The taste is sweet malts, pine and a little dark fruit. Resiny; a little boozy. Good beer

Lovely ruby red with a tan coloured head, good persistence.
Aroma of caramel, brown sugar, toffee, citrus like grapefruit, orange. So sweet! 
Wonderful in the mouth: medium to full body, creamy texture, lovely soft carbonation. The malty backbone is really nice, giving caramel and fruits. Then the hops balance perfectly in the back end. So juicy and easy drinking (for a 8,7% ABV!!!!!). Wish I could find it more frequently here in Italy! I¬ím just in love with that.
Straight from the can. Nose is toffee, caramel. Taste is thick syrupy, some resin, caramel and a hing of molasses with a slight bitter finish.

Strong balanced taste with bold malts, bourbon and fruits. Medium/strong body with medium/light carbonation. Alcohol comes bit trough. Overall, great product with nothing to add, perhaps some distinctive character. 8 3 9 4 17.

Pours amber with a large head.
Nose shows resinous and floral hops along with heavy clean malt.
Flavours include resinous hops, pine, booze and heavy syrupy malt.

Can to glass- would have given more on appearance if possible...a vibrant reddish-copper amber with a cookie colored, 2 finger head that lasts. Spotty lace. Aroma is earthy and hoppy, celery and citrus. Balance carries over well to the tongue.. Nothing really pops in the taste but a lot is there for the taking. Earthiness, pineapple, sweet bready malts.  Caramel, dark cherry and a hoppy shell towards the end.... Complex yet fresh. Well masked ABV.... Very well done, the best I¬íve had from the brewery.
.355l can @Explosive. Pours clear reddish copper with medium head. Aroma is dark malts, bread, caramel, syrup notes, dark fruits, citrus fruits. Flavor is mostly same with hoppy finish.

Draught at the Oskar Blues Home Made Liquid and Solids, Longmont, CO. 
Clear red color with a small off-white head.
Mild sweet malty and hoppy aroma. 
The flavor is dry hops, moderate bitterness and sweetish malt.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can from Sedona poured into a glass. Pours red with a nice head. Aroma is citrus hops, pineapple, caramel. Taste is citrus peel, orange bits, some caramel. Quite tasty.

Poured from a 12 oz can dated for January 2016. Looks incredible in the glass with a slick Amber color with a thick creamy off white head that LASTS. The aromas are toast, sweet caramel, trace of pineapple and pine. In the taste I get smooth sweet caramel, toast and tropical hops that finish pine dry.

From can in IPA glass. Pours copperish red with beautifully dense two-finger head (not unlike the photo). Dank hop aroma with a bit of ethanol and rich taste as malt sweetness is slowly replaced with hop bitterness in the finish. Excellente.
From a can. This thing is a hop slap in the mouth with pine, grass and citrus flavours and a thick resinous finish. Pretty good stuff and dangerously drinkable for such a big ABV.

Can from Beer Cartel 200916. Just the thought of an Imperial Red IPA is enough to make you rip into this beer but at 8.7% ABV it is best to tread carefully. Looks like a hybrid red ale and IPA with a full head of thick looking foam and a russett copper colour that invites you in. The aroma is all malt, sweet caramel and toffee and the flavour is even more malt with vanilla, toffee and again that caramel. This beer is dangerously drinkable and I think that it would creep up on you and bite you if you didn¬ít give it the respect that it deserves. Smooth, sweet malty finish and leaves a nice trail of tan lacing snaking its¬í way from the top of the glass to the bottom. Great beer.

12 oz can from Hawthorne Cellars in Brisbane. Pours deep red with medium tan head. Mild malty aroma. Taste is really well balanced with malt leading the way but the citrus and resin from the hops also very present. Very well balanced and enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

G¬íknight imperial red pours a deep reddish brown, nice head and lace. Aromas of citrus hops and some caramel malts. Flavor is much the same with the hops taking the forefront with the malts playing a supporting role. A very, good and solid beer. Originally rated on 6/5/2011.

Can courtesy of Geraint and Helen, cheers you two! Consumed at home, sat outside in the garden and now making tonights tea, Spiced Lamb with Samphire and Sumac Salad, Sunday 11th September 2016   The nose has that very familiar malt driven, aroma, burnt sugar, toffee I guess, amber in colour with an off-white head, it¬ís a little hazy also, in fact it¬ís a lot hazy. It¬ís lazy, it¬ís soft, lovely lilting mouthfeel, slightly boozy, the hops, toffee and booziness comes through in the mouth as well. This is a jolly good beer, solid red Impy IPA leading to plenteous of hoppy burps. A7 A3 T8 P5 Ov15 3.8

Can at home. Pours a clear deep mahogany colour with small off-white head. Aroma grapefruit, red berries, pine, caramel, wet cardboard, leather and grass. The flavour is similar with more grapefruit, pine and grassy hops. Has a slick mouth feel, full-bodied and a solid but balanced bitterness. A hoppy and piney ale but is well-balanced and pretty aromatic and tasteful.

I love a hoppy red. Make it imperial and I love it twice as much. Plenty of piney, citrus bitter hops in here. To be honest, the bitterness swamps the caramel notes a little bit. Gotta dig for them. Great stuff.

Woody, some caramel/date, some mild black pepper spice, some grass too. Alcohol hidden well ¬ñ a trait in common with its stablemate ¬ìGubna¬î Imperial IPA (tried alongside this beer) ¬ñ or you could this is under-powered? It¬ís v drinkable - that¬ís for sure.
[Sidenote: text on rim of can continues this brewery¬ís herby theme: ¬ìcan¬ío bliss. satisfy ya.¬î]

Draught @ Brewdog Helsinki. 
Deep amber color, thin white head, lasting. 
Caramel, some wood, hops, malts. 
Flavor has malts, boozy notes, hops, caramel, toffee. Long finish. Bodied, nice kick. Good stuff.
0,25l on tap @ Oljenkorsi. Pours clear red with a low creamy beige head. Aroma is malts, fruits and pine. Flavor is creamy malts, pine, fruit, alcohol and hops. Smooth. Excellent.

On tap and 12oz can. Pours a dark amber color with a slightly off white head that sticks around. Aroma of citrusy hops lead on the nose and are followed by a floral sweetness. Maltiness if noticeable, but not overwhelming. Taste is bright but slightly resiny and citrus hops that lead perfectly into malty sweetness with a great balance. The alcohol is hidden well, and leaves tropical notes on the tongue. Finishes smoothly and not too bitter. Carbonation is near perfect. Body is full, but still drinkable.

Keg at Andrew Usher¬ís. Hazy ruby body with a thin beige head that fades. Aroma of caramel and stewed tea. Flavour of golden syrup and toffee apple with a peppery hop finish. Medium body with a oily, chewy mouthfeel. Rich, sweet and hoppy. Nice.

355ml can. Pours a hazy deep red with a medium, frothy, long lasting beige head that laces nicely. Sweet aroma of grapefruit, caramel malt and pine. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, bread, grapefruit, pine and alcohol with a dry, woody finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Very nice.

33cl can from brewdog online shop. Color is copper. Appearance is clear. Head is thin to medium and white. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Very balanced. Aroma is pine, hops, malt, orange, wood, herbs. Great!
355 ml can at Brewers Beer Bar, G√∂teborg. Copper coulour with off white head. Fruity, grapefruit, resin, zest, pine, caramel and marmelade. Dry with high bitterness and medium carbonation.
Amber red pour, thin cream head. Aroma of light citrus. Flavor is crisp citrus with some malts.

DATE: June 26, 2016... OCCASION: on the eve of Willow Lake Camp summer six, we begin with Shark Week too!... GLASSWARE: Maudite snifter.... pours a dense ruby red body that sports a strong two-finger off-white head that settles to a craggy, chunky half finger of unevenness... lovely floral overtones with the pine that makes an IPA great...thick bread malts form a wall against which a rum-like alcoholic strength is developed... smooth, confident, medium-bodied with a creamy aspect--way too accessible for a beer nearing 9% ABV... mango, grapefruit and sweet pine roil into a strong malt base that strikes caramel and bread... sticky resin enhances the experience--deliciousness! The Oskar Blues folks know how to brew--as well as how to honor the patriarchs of the class beer world... unbelievably agreeable in its palate and rewarding in its flavor profile... another (!) Oskar Blues champion, one I would reach for among others in the genre....

Very nicely done, with a creamy texture full of abundant caramel and brown sugar malt flavors giving way to a refreshing piney hop finish, with the heat covered well. Slight citrus notes add balance and complexity.

Copper color, off-white head. Malty nose, ripe fruit, caramel, bread, yeast. Sweet malty taste, ripe fruity, raisins, yeast, bread, hint of resin, moderate bitterness. Medium body, soft to average carbonation, sticky texture.

Tap at the brewery with ECBT crew. 10 oz pour. Copper/amber color with a pleasant off white head. Nose is more malty than anticipated but with a musty hop pine note. Taste is big and assertive with a malty backbone working well with a hoppy bitterness. Finish has a lingering hop presence with a burnt sugar feel. Full bodied but clean. A few of these without certainly make for a long g¬íknight.
Can from brewdog shef. Attractibe rosy amber colour, small off white head. Aroma is piney and caramel. Taste is bitter and savoury. Prickly and oily. Good.
Can. Pours amber red with small lasting head. Aroma is caramel, malt, wood and alcohol. Taste is dominated by alcohol, but malt, oak and some caramel is also present.

Can. Aroma is alcohol, pine, some malts, grass, hint of citrus. Amber red, clear, nice beige head. Medium sweetness, light bitter, taste is alcohol, malt, light caramel, pine, grass, hay, citrus, bread crust. Medium+ body, medium carbonation, medium long finish with some sweetness and bitterness. Some alcohol warmth. Nice.

Can. Pours an amber red with a thin mostly lasting beige head. Aroma is of caramel, pine, citrus, oak, alcohol. Taste is of red fruits, caramel, slightly burnt, citrus, grapefruit, blood orange. Oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
On tap st P&P Charleston. Clear light Amber with medium off-white head. Aroma is dank hops, medium body, medium carbonation, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is Amber malt and herbal hops.
Can from mchughs. Pours clear red with slight off white head. Pine, citrus, earth, wood notes. Sweet caramel flavour with mild earthy bitterness. Nice
Can. Pours clearish amber red. Nice foamy head. Aroma caramel, honey, pine. Flavor of sweet caramel light citrus. Nice smooth bitterness. Slick sticky mouthfeel. Very tasty.
Red imperial pale ale with large head. Full hop flavour, caramel, citrus, piny.

Appearance: dark ruby, more like a IIPA than an imperial red. 
Aroma: citrus out the Ying yang with some sweet caramel malt backing it up. 
Taste: sweet malt and a citrus bang from the hops.
Overall: really nice imperial red, although not so much red in appearance and flavour. Otherwise, such an easy drinking IIPA.

Burk. Fyllig lite syrlig fruktig doft. Doften balanserad o angen√§m. Smaken lite syrlig som √§r signifikativt f√∂r en red ipa. H√§r √§r r√∂da b√§r som b√§rs upp av en trevlig maltighet. √ñlen kr√§mig i munnen med en bra balanserad beska. Bra.

12 ounce can. Orange copper with a frothy beige head. Rich caramel malt nose with piney hops. Chewy roasted malt flavor has burnt caramel and spicy notes. Rich and malty with toasted nuts and dried fruit notes. Fruity malt in middle. Resiny hops in finish. Sticky mouthfeel. Overall, an excellent Red Ale with a complex balanced flavor.

Thanks to Mr Knight for your service, and thanks to Oskar Blues for the fantastic tribute. Tap to a tulip. Big amber beer with a hearty fine bubbled leggy head. Nose is all amber. Front has a honey amber sweetness. Certainly sticky lips. Hops plunge right to a warm malty middle. Finish seems quick, but pleasing and clean.

Lukt: Citrus og karamell.
Utseende: M√∏rk gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Citrus og noe karamell.

From 12oz can to snifter. Pour is a nice ruby red orange, thick white head. Nose is hoppy, malt, piney, citrus. Taste is medium bodied, bitter but touches of sweet coming through. Finishes slightly dry but with a long taste on the palate. Good beer

Keg at Brewdog Manchester. A clear orangey copper colour with a medium beige head. Aroma of toasted malts, some caramel, orange, slight pine, a little chocolate and a touch of whisky warmth. Taste of toasted malts, some caramel, orange, subtle grapefruit, a little chocolate, slight brown sugar and a kind of spirit warmth. Full bodied and a sticky texture. A sweetish, orangey, spirity finish. An interesting beer, complex aroma and flavour that I believe my tastebuds aren¬ít good enough to describe. Sweeter than I thought and not as boozy. Good.
Slight haze to an orange brown pour with sticky white head. Aroma is malty sweet citrus. Taste follows nose with a light alcohol bite.

Aroma: Medium citrus, orange, Medium malt, sweetness, toffee, toast. 
Appearance: Brilliant copper body. Large, off-white head. Good retention. Lacing
Flavour: Medium-high bitterness. Medium high hops, citrus, citrus peel Medium malt sweetness, balancing, toasty, marshmallows. Dry finish with lingering citrus, tropical fruit, bitterness.
Mouthfeel: Medium-full body. Medium carbonation. Smooth. Light alcohol.
Overall: Amazing! Perfect.

473 ml can, poured. Thanks Andre!
(Imperial) 21B. Red IPA.

Fra fat (!) p√• M2 Cardinal, skudd√•rsaften: klar r√∏dlig ravfarge med fint skum som varer. R√∏de b√¶r, karamell, r√∏de epler og etpar granskudd i den deilige duften. Smaken likes√• - balansert og lekker og med en myk og elegant bitterhet i ettersmaken. God til siste dr√•pe.

Keg at Doghouse. Pours amber with a pinkisly-brown head which recedes. Aroma is caramel and toffee. Taste is caramel sweet, toffee sweet, slight resin, a touch earthy, medium bitter. Sticky mouthfeel.
Can at Cafe Sara, january 30th 2015. Cobber body with a small beige head. Aroma of caramel malt and pine, thick sweet toffee taste with flowery hops and cherries. Sweet alcohol finish with fruit.
dark copper color with about a finger of off white head. Aroma is sweet malt and citrus hops. Flavor is heavy caramel malt with citrus and pine hops. sweet and sticky.
On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours clear deep copper red with off-white head. Aroma of caramel, pine needles, raisins, dark fruits. Tastes a bit sweet with a bitter finish.

Pours mahogany with an off-white head. Getting a hoppy, grassy aroma (slight citrus). Taste is hops upfront with an underlying malt sweetness. Slightly bitter back end. Lively carbonation that you can feel on tip of tongue and back of throat. Alcohol is masked pretty decently, but can feel it in the head pretty quickly. 

Pretty good beer. Might not be a go to beer, but will probably get again.
Smells of uber sweet malt. Aroma is nice medium brown with lacing and head. Tastes fairly balanced, a little heavy on the malt, but it is not too sweet. Creamy. Good.

pours deep ruby amber with a medium off white head. Aroma is a wonderful sweet floral and orange citrus. The orange citrus comes through in the taste as well. Hoppy, but not all that bitter. Almost a bitter-sweetness that follows all the way through the finish. Very mild bitter linger. The 8.7% alcohol is masked incredibly well. Not boozy at all. This is really good beer.  Seems every Oskar Blues I try is another home run!  They¬íre in the IPA zone.
A good easy drinking IPA with a smooth finish no bitter after taste would recommend.
Pours a dark honey red brown with a thick, creamy head. Aroma is caramel and malt. The taste is a huge malty backbone with a bitter finish. Another excellent beer.
From can. Pours a dark honey red color. One plus finger cream colored head. Aroma of caramel and malts. Taste is nicely sweet, balanced, rich and full. Medium mouthfeel.
Pours clear red-copper with an off white head. Nose is floral hops and red malt. Flavor is fairly bitter but well balanced. Alcohol is well hidden.
Pours a dull Ruby red color. Small head with good carbonation. Looks like a Irish Red Ale but tastes like an I.P.A.

(Can). Pours a beautiful amber complexion with thick head and glass lacing. Alcohol comes through in flavor. Otherwise a decent boozy red ale with hop bite. Not my favorite from this excellent Brewer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2016 On tap at the brewery taproom in Brevard in Dec. 2015.. 

Red-amber body with high clarity and a good head that leaves excellent lacing.

About average hoppiness for style in both the aroma and the flavor, yet the medium malts still manage to show, providing nice caramel notes and with fait bread and some sweetness to counter the bitterness, Mild-moderate bitterness. Notably more hoppy and piney than OB¬ís Pinner IPA. 

Medium body with lively, medium+ carbonation. 

Overall: a very well balanced IPA\Irish Red hybrid. Partially hidden alcohol.

Oskar Blues G¬íKnight Imperial Red has nice malt flavors but not particularly outstanding. Red pour with a frothy head giving way to malt aromas. Taste is a mild malt profile -- drinkable but watery given the deScription. G¬íKnight is a decent red.

On tap. Served a nice mahogany color with a good head that lingered. Aroma of citrus, bit of malt and spice. Taste of malt sweetness with a nice touch of spice, with just a bit of the hops peeking through. Subtle bitterness and a clean feel. Medium body, full flavor, nicely blended. Nice beer to kick back and relax with.

Not really my thing. Looks beautiful - nice ruby-copper with lasting, clingy top. Aroma is somewhat musty, spicy earthen with some resin notes. Flavor has a good bitter at the front, amongst tropical fruits, that ends up lingering unpleasantly. Not a very clean finish. Maybe a bit more malt than I¬íd like. Sometimes dipas do this unbalanced thing I don¬ít so much enjoy.
Klar amber farve med med kremet lys beige skum. Lukt av malt, karamell, frukt og furun√•l. Smak av malt, karamell, n√∏tter og krydder. Lett bitter ettersmak. Vinmonopolet.
16 oz can. Mahogany in color with a tan head. Sweet caramel and citrus flavoring with a minimal amount of bitterness at the end.
UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 Posiblemente la mejor cerveza del mundo en su estilo. Brutal! Mega compensada y rica como ella sola!
Pours deep Clear amber. Aroma is nicely balanced, hops and malts. taste has good amounts of hop bitterness, nicely balanced. Very Nice.

Aroma: caramel, pine, citrus
Appearance: clear amber, tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious

CAN. Poured copper with small off white head.. Biscuit malts dominate nose with a slight sweetness.. Malt dominant, sweet caramel/toffee upfront then a hoppy/malt middle finishing with a hoppy bitterness, malts linger through back end.. Sourced RW

47,3cl can shared by Arve_Christian - thanks a lot! Pours slightly hazy amber with a modest off-white white head. Hoppy aroma with lots of caramel, pine and some tropical fruits. Sweet, hoppy and caramelly with a decent bitterness. Nice hop juice, quite refreshing.

On can from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge. Deep amber color, good foam. Medium high aroma intensity; hoppy, roasted, malt, fruity, dried fruits. Medium full body & complexity. Solid bitterness, some sweetness- balances well. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear red with dense white head. Floral, melon, caramel, spicy and green. Sweet, floral, herbal and hoppy finish. Overall: Very nice. Great craftsmanship.

Can to glass. Pours a deep red amber color with a foamy tan head. Aroma has a nice juicy hop character with a solid malt backbone. Flavor is much more on the malt side, with hints of molasses, booze. Delicious.

A deep red IPA. Has the smells you associate with an IPA. Piney, grapefruit, various citrus fruits, a hint of the malt. Poured a finger of head with a alight aggressive pour need the end in a pint glass. The head didn¬ít last long nor did it leave any lace on the glass. Initial taste is the same as the smell. It doesn¬ít pack as powerful as a punch that you would find with well known examples of west coast IPAs but the flavor is there no doubt. Comparatively it tasted a touch sweeter past the initial taste and had a pleasant aftertaste that stuck around for quite awhile. It didn¬ít leave early or overstay it¬ís welcome. Extremely smooth. The only IPA that beats it in smoothness to date is AleSmith¬ís IPA. Overall, I kept reaching back for the beer after a few sips. Something I would buy again many times as long as I can find it.
Well balanced red with a deep amber color. A hint of sour on the finish. Definitely a hearty beer though.

Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Golden brown with an off white foam. Biscuit and toffee malts with pine. Grapefruit pith with minerals and peppery but not aggressive alcohol. Nutty with spiced oranges and brown sugar. Nothing new here, it¬ís just a very good beer.

On keg at Shuffledog, Leeds and previously drank from cans from Total Wine, Miami, FL. Deep amber colour with off-white creamy head. Very malty but it doesn¬ít overpower the hops. Sweet, piney, coton candy, caramely, biscuty and DANK. Well hidden ABV. Sticky, and juicy. Very "American" in that I¬íve never had a beer from a UK brewery that has been able to pull this off.  Top notch.

1pint can from Total Wine, Tampa.

Ar√¥me au bouquet agrumes, C-hops, malt caramel-p√¢le, ambre et un agr√©able r√©tro fruit√© de pamplemousse.

Can.

A- Caramel, pine, malty.

A- Mahogany color, hazy liquid, tan head.

T- Caramel, alcohol, pine, slightly bitter, malty, seaweed, slightly sweet.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, funky finish.

O- Lots of caramel but then an odd resinous seaweed taste to it. I was surprised it wasn¬ít real bitter though.

Naming a beer after someone is a dangerous proposition. If you want to capture someone¬ís legacy with some ale and suds, you want it to be the best ale and suds you can make. The beer is a living, changing testament to someone¬ís existence. Oskar Blues does the tribute beer right. While G¬íKnight is a bit of a stylistic oddity (Is it a Strong Ale? An Imperial IPA? Does Red (Imperial) IPA deserve its own category?), it¬ís brewed in the tradition of Lagunitas Sucks and Stone Arrogant Bastard: lots of hops but also lots of malt. Color is ruby red with eggshell suds. Aroma is redolent of pine, citrus, and caramel. Flavor: bitter grapefruit, juicy orange, grass, pine, and caramel. This is a viscous brew but it¬ís plenty crisp. It¬ís a worthy tribute to a deserving individual.
Pours a cloudy darker reddish color with off-white head. Citrus, pine, and caramel malts on the nose; follows onto the palate. Full bodied red ale here. Finishes with a nice citrusy hop note.
Can. Very assertive American hoppiness both in flavour and bitterness. Resiny, citrusy zesty. Alcohol evident, mostly in the finish. Also lots of candyish malty sweetness.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 Can kindly shared by Miro, many thanks. Amber color with medium white head. Caramel, citrus hops in aroma. Sweet caramel taste with light citrus hops. Medium long hoppy bitter finish. Very good.

Appearance: pours with a large light tan head, the beer is a dark amber color with a hue of red to it, head settles into a nice density
Aroma: grass, dank, pine 
Taste: has a caramel malt backbone, some alcohol warmth is evident, nice strong bitterness, 
Palate: thick mouthfeel, bitter aftertaste, average carbonation 
Overall: a good beer but probably not one of my favorite imperial ipa's, the alcohol comes thru in the taste a bit too much

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour is a dark red with a large creamy tan head. Aroma is a nice piney hop with a slick oliy malt. Flavor is again a decent hop with a decent heavy malt and I do get a bit of alcohol. It¬ís decent and ok nothing much more than that as the hops and malt don¬ít really overpower the other they are just there.
Great aromas and flavors of strong earthy malts with a good piney hops presence. Mild sweetness adds balance. Pretty dark amber hue and medium weight with strong carbonation.
This is such an awesome beer! Blissfully rich and caramel with a nice hop profile that is floral. Seriously, this is just one of the best.

Keg (Brewdog, Shepherd¬ís Bush)
Full malty aroma. Keggy fizzy palate. Full malty body too. Sticky malts. Some earthy bitterness. Rather dull but decent. Covers the alcohol well. Very wll. Bonus point for that.

Imperial red ipa. POurs a copper red amber. Sweet marshmellow caramel aroma, mineral light yeast ester.low hop. Taste is strong, strong dry malt, burnt caramel almost roast like , toast caramel. Has a tart/sweet cherry character to the malt. Woody dry. Creamy. Dry finish. Red ipa is my favorate style not imperial red this is above or average for imperial red. Decent. Lacking aroma for being 20 days old and canned. Kindof on the dry hot alcoholy side.

Pours rusty copper and amber, hazy. Off white head with good lacing. Aroma is resin, pine, carmel with hints of citrus. Sweet with sticky mouth feel. Really great balance of bitterness for me. Beyond the profile of a red ale and speaks of an almost barley wine quality. Carmel and resin back end that finishes nice. Boozy but balamced. One of my personal favorites from Oskar Blues.

Oskar Blues G¬íKnight has a thick, yellowish, cream-colored head and a murky, rust red appearance, with lots of substantial lacing left behind. The aroma is of somewhat musty, fruity, acidic, hop resin, and the flavor is of the pine resin (hop oil), red grapefruit, acid, sweet white bread, bread crust, and relatively mild bitterness, brought on, probably, by the high alcohol level. Mouthfeel is rather heavy and even gritty, to an extent (an Oskar Blues characteristic, I find). Oskar Blues G¬íKnight finishes mostly dry and pretty easily drank.
Very strong beer. Very red and overtly hoppy but stronger red than the ipa tastes. Tap

Dark orange with a medium tan head. Sweet hoppy aroma. Smooth medium
Bodied and spicey. A lot of malt and a grainy hop bitter

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rockwells on tap. First time on nitro. Still getting into the ratings concept but this is an excellent beer. Nice taste, nice color, beautiful head and lacing. Tastes deceptively of a lower ABV with hops without damaging the palate.

On tap at Boise Brewing. Pours out a nice ruby brown, soft beige head, lots of lacing. Caramelly, nutty, peaty, exceptionally smooth. Elevated IPA plays into whole scenario, accenting aroma, flavor and finish. Nicely done.
Pretty good imperial. Nice aroma but lingers a bit long but to be expected. Worth buying.

Pours a dark red-brown with a huge pillowy, white head. Wild and wooly lacing. Nose is bready at first and then a bouquet of hoppy bliss. Notes of grapefruit pith. Taste is bitter and refreshing. Astringent finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Excellent!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Global Brew. Pours a dark copper with a decent off white head. Mild hop flower aroma. Taste is caramel malt, and a pleasant hoppy, grassiness from the dry hopping.
Had this beer a couple of different ways. American hoppy red that is strong and delicious. On Nitro it¬ís dangerous, you can crush it.

4 oz chilled pour into a cylindrical tasting glass from tap at the brewery¬ís taphouse. Fresh as can be! Absolutely beautiful beer. Amber/ruby, clear, with a moderate and attractive head. Very malty and very hoppy. A hop-forward, well-developed, full-bodied, and aggressive beer.

Can. Appearance is dark red with lots of head. Aroma is citrus, pine, and brown sugar. Taste is citrus, pine, mixed in with a sweet malty backbone. Pretty solid, nice balance of citrus, pine, and malty sweetness without being too syrupy or bold, alcohol is very well hidden...dangerous.

On tap at at Fox pub, Peoria.
Fresh tangerines in the nose with a little medicine (Pacific gem?) and faint grapefruit and pine accents. Hazy red-brown under an eternal tawny, lacy cover. Flavour is potent orange and strawberry hops, but then ethanol, blending into creamsickle. Hops bitterness is thankfully subdued, but present. Medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth and slightly warming.

Poured from a tap. Clear copper color, medium frothy off white head. Floral aroma. Medium body with a oily hops flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big, thick white head with dark golden colour. Smells of lovely fresh hops - big grassy aroma. Smooth palate with some fruitiness & a bitter but balanced end. A beautiful brew!

Rated by BrewTom
strong citrusy aroma. red in color, clear with decent head. very nice citrus hop flavors

Poured from can, copper red hue with thick creamy tan head, decent lacing, smells of caramel malt and leather yeast with some fruit hops, medium body, smooth and silky with light bitter aftertaste, alcohol well hidden, a little too syrupy and brown sugar sweet, some oak, tropical juicy fruit adds adds another dimension

Can - 473ml. Beautiful copper body with a thin, lasting, off-white frothy head. Robust hoppy aroma with malty, citrusy, cinnamon, and caramel hints. Alcohol is not too agressive. Its sharp, strong hoppy taste carries malty, oaky, brown sugar, and fruity notes. Ends with a long, strong, bittersweet finish. Well done.

From 16oz can, NC brewery, poured into 16oz tulip glass

Aroma: Big American "C" hops, citrusy, pines, 

Appearance: amber, clear, big frothy tan head, good retention

Taste: Medium bitter, light sweet

Palate: medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, bitter dry finish

Overall: A really, really great Imperial Red IPA. Really enjoy the hop selection on this ale. The medium body highlights some of the Red Ale malts. While it¬ís big on hops and bitterness, the malty backbone makes it a well balanced beer. Loads of fruity, citrusy, and piney hops.

Canned. Pours clear amber with an average off-white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, caramel, pine and peachy notes. Sweet flavor that end up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice and hoppy Red.

On tap at the Tap Works in Chicago served in a snifter. Nice red color, quickly fading reddish head, nice lacing. Fruity aroma with malt, nicely hopped. 
Another really good brew from Oskar Blues.
16.1.2015. Aroma of exotic fruits. Taste of exotic fruits, pineapple, passionfruit.

16oz can pours dark clear amber red with a finger and a half of head. Malt driven but more balance than Deviant Dales with some creamy malt toast caramel mixing with nice fruity citrus, mango, peach notes. Finishes with medium sweetness and bitterness, some lingering citrus and light piney tropical fruit, toast. Good.

Can. Nice hop aroma with great malt balance. Velvet smooth on tongue, great finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours clear bright medium dark golden orange with a creamy reviving light orange cap, nice lacing. tons of fruity maltiness - wild berries, strawberries, woodsy coconut, citrus and ginger, delicate pine, clean yeast, grapefruit peel and pepper. average to light carbonation, medium body - oily and sticky; almost balanced fruitypiney-citrusy finish. this ale represents the idea of this (sully) style. much enjoyed! big, heady and hefty without being bold and aggressive.
Pours dark red with thick tannish head. Smell is citrus, mango, cherry, orange and pine. Taste is pine, citrus, mango and floral hops. Medium body, medium carb. Excellent.
Nitro tap at Olympic. From notes. Dank with citrus hops, fruity yeast and a sweet finish.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2015 Big can shared by Dino, thanks! Pours medium amber with an off white head. Aroma is caramel, pine. Flavor follows, some earthiness near the finish.
Quite hoppy smell, taste is hoppy off the bat, mellows with time of course..scores higher as time goes on...
Tap at Blind Tiger, New York. Colour is ruby with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Some fruits, sweetness, caramel, hops and malts.

Keg at BD Shepherd¬ís Bush tap takeover, London. It pours a dark reddish copper color with a medium tan head. Aroma is medium sweet and quite leafy and hoppy, with notes of toffee, caramel malts, ripe mango, dried fruits, dried leaves, earth, mixed nuts. Taste is sweet with a bitter hoppy finish. Lightly grainy, toffee, candy sugar, ripe apricots, dried berries and leaves, wet soil. Medium to full bodied with creamy texture and lively carbonation. Overall, nice and bold

I poured this beer from a growler and admired its beauty for a moment.  Halfway through my pint I thought this is a beer worth reviewing, so I gulped it down so I could assess the beer from square one.  Now I just want to enjoy this Imperial buzz.  Laces the side of a glass like you're drawing the shades at night, ready for bed.  Heavy aroma, boozy, more going on than I care to talk about right now. G'Knight.

dark red 1 finger off-white head. Nose is pretty intense. very pine forward, almost medicine like so intense. taste is also pretty intense. lots of pine, mango, fruit, apple. but it¬ís all masked by an intense bitterness.
Draft at Parlor City. Pours clear dark amber with off white head and lacing. Nose is caramel and dank hops. Taste is similar. Nice hopiness.

Ah, Gordon. A winter drink for hop heads. Pours dark red amber from the can, good lacing. Smell is grapefruit, pine, dank hops. Taste is sweet, resiny caramel, nicely hopped with a superb thick chewy mouthfeel. The sweetness plus the hops plus the booze soothes the soul--a good one to put you to sleep.

Aka Gordon! From 16oz can to glass. Hazy reddish amber with some muddy tan. Manilla tan head that lasts. Hoppy aroma of citrus, lemon, and grass. Malt notes include some red fruit. Well balanced with sweet toasted red malts, dry citrus grass hops and light fruity yeast to round it out. Thick chewy and thick mouth feel. Its a classic. Long live Gordon!

50cl can at some dart joint. Poured red, with an off white head. Nose is caramel, pine, nice malt sweetness, hoppy. Flavour is caramel, malt sweetness with some hops to balance it out. Very easy gor the abv.

On tap @ brewdog, Edinburgh. Body is clear amber, head is small white creamy. Nose is caramel, aroma is light olasses, honey, cereal, light herbs. Medium sweet medium hoppy and roasty bitter. Medium body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Easy one.

Draught at Brewdog Edinburgh. 
Clear amber-reddish appearance with a medium off white-tan head. Malty aroma with some caramel and fruity hops-yeasts. Nice body with a bit of caramel, after a while the toasted nuts and some caramel arrives. Just a bit of hops in the finish.

Tap at BrewDog Liverpool. Hazy amber shade with lacing. Fluffy white cap. Heavy on caramel with pine also in the aroma. Tastes of strawberry jam, other red fruits and a faint floral edge. Much softer and fruitier than I expected, with an almost chewy texture. Pretty solid but a heftier malt backbone might have kicked it up a notch.

It pours a cloudy brown with a full head. There are aromas of dried fruit, malt caramel. It has a rich feel to it with flavors of dried fruit, caramel, citrus, and a moderate bitter finish. There is also a considerate amount of lacing that it produces.
Pours an amber color with a minimal pine and citrus aroma. Taste is slightly bitter with a small caramel bitterness in the aftertaste. A decent beer for the style, a little hoppier than expected.

Look: pours a dark Amber. Very clear. Off white head. 
Smell: dank. Citrus. Grapefruit. Orange. 
Taste: dank. Citrus. Grapefruit. Orange tangerine.
Feel: very dry. Leaves a thin film on the mouth. Makes you want to take another drink. 
Overall: great beer. Love the aroma. Nice flavors. 
First drank: hime 1/17/15
Vintage: 12/29/14

Keg tapped Leeds. Red amber ok head lace. Aroma is fruity pine taste same lots of resin caramel tons of sweet malts and good long hoppy bitters great balance. Nice oily mouthfeel prickly carbonated. V good tasty
Draught. Copper red with large foamy head, crisp malt aroma, hoppy caramel taste, medium carbonation, long hoppy finish, alcohol buzz as an aftereffect on your tongue. As hoppy as a DIPA.

Brassy colored with a luscious, hoppy beige head. Full bodied hop aroma akin to an American Strong Ale. Powerful fruity, juicy, pineapple and floral hoppiness. Strong juicy, punchy hop body with a blend of grapefruit, pineapple, and orange, with a touch of vodka. Alcohol presence amplifies the fruit notes. Strong stuff, but there is a enough balance to hold this together.

Pours a gorgeous reddish color with excellent lacing and decent head retention. Smells malty and bitter. Not much floral aroma, but it is a red after all. Tastes of alcohol and lots of malt. A great beer!

This unique double IPA has an amber hue and white head. Monster aromas of sticky / piney / resiny hops are unforgettable. Seriously overhopped, but the caramel maltiness is what makes this more than just another IPA. One of my absolute favorite IPAs!

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2015 Pours a smooth creamy copper with s thick tan head. Aroma is hops and citrus and not overpowered by the alcohol. Very smooth and drinkable. Caramel and citrusy red, and a thick mouthfeel.
Amber coloured and hazy. Has a white head. Heavy sweet, malty aroma, toasted and hoppy finish.
I usually assume imperials to be on the bitter side for my taste, but surprisingly not the case with this beer. Dry hops seem to make a big difference. Overall very impressed with oskar blues!

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2015 On tap at Park Tavern. Cooper golden nearly amber color of white head. Nice creamy amber red style mouth-feel with caramel sweetness. Balanced with lots of tropical piney hop flavors and bitterness. Finish is nice and hopy but not ultra bitter like deviant dales.
On tap at Barley and Vine. Pours a rich amber and sports a great hop aroma! Rich maltiness followed by an amazing hop flavor and firm hop bitterness.

This is a big ole heavy DIPA. Looks amazing, great palate for the style, overall very well made. Drinkable, just very filling. More hops than malt, but not overwhelming. Good offering from a brewery that is growing on me.

On tap at Park Tavern, Navy Yard DC. Pours beautiful copper color with about a finger head. Aroma of grains and caramelized sugar. Palate of typical with Oskar Blues beers. Taste of excellent hops flavors with caramelized sweetness. Pretty high ABV but a darn good purchase.

Poured from a can, great aroma. Poured a dark amber. Tastes sweet and malty with a hoppy slightly boozy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can (16oz $3.80): Golden red with one finger head. Great aroma. Description pretty accurate... sticky, and malty. Somewhat sweet. Only a slight bitterness. I think it should have a little more bitterness to balance out the sweetness..
1 pint can poured into pint glass. Great aroma and appearance. Didn¬ít deliver on any flavor for me, but it was alright.

It poured a hazy light copper color with an off-white head. The aroma was of light malts with citrus, pine and a little caramel. The taste was of caramel, herbal spices, mango and some pine/grass bitterness with a little bite. Tasty.

Have had this from a tallboy can and on draft, both at BD Brum, Aug ¬í13 and May ¬í14. Pours clear rich deep ruby, cream head which stays reasonably. Nose of rich bready biscuity malt, darkish caramel, some berry fruit and lots of resinous and citrus hops. Tastes sweet burnt sugar and caramel, big bitterness too, perfect balance really. Lots of citrus and piney aromatics. Medium full body, oily. Great beer, really enjoyable. Super-drinkable considering its strength.

poured a clear garnet with a lasting amber head. Aromas of carmel, pine, and some earthiness with a hint of citrus. Palate was medium bodied, dry and slightly resiny. Flavors of toffee, mild licorice,pine and some earthiness with a lingering, dry, bitter finish.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 Fantastic foamy light tan tall head with dark Amber color poured from 16 oz can. Lots of lacing that last forever. Great mouth feel and tons of flavor with very fine finish.  Definitely a beer I will have many times again.

On tap at Stone Escondido. Pours Amber with a thin off white head. Nose is citrus pine and slight floral. Some malt. Mildly bitter. Finishes clean. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a coupla two tree tall boy cans into the pint glass, nice foam and good red look. Just enough hops to be smooth, and doesn¬ít taste as strong as it is, but it is. Glad you named it after a brother.

47cl (16oz) can, as G¬íKnight Imperial Red IPA, American brew, thx alot to Hans for the bonus!, very complex bitter brew, malty/woody/bitter and slightly fruity/sweet, balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 This is a superb Imperial Red IPA from CO that is right up there with the best strong IPAs in the front range.  Stronger than Dale¬ís Pale Ale and up there with (Titan and Myrcenery, double IPAs).  Not as much Hop nose as Myrcenery, but no big deal.  This kills Odell¬ís Double IPA but is a close second to Odell¬ís Myrcenery Double IPA, Two Strong IPAs I¬íve tasted recently from the mile high corridor.  Drink one and enjoy!

Beautiful ruby-orange color and a huge head. Smell is toffee with a crisp hops background; overall very subtle. Taste has a strong caramel character with some spicy hop flavor and a ridiculously smooth finish.

The beer pours a hazy reddish orange color with a large off-white head, and the aroma blends loads of caramel and biscuity malts with even more citrus hops. The taste is mildly bitter and mildly sweet, and the aftertaste continues to blend the malty sweetness with the grapefruity hop flavors. The palate has slightly sticky texture, soft carbonation that intensifies in the mouth, and a medium body.
Great looking and great smelling beer that, while still packing a punch, does not quite deliver as promised in the mouth. Nicely piney with a mildly fruity sweetness from start to finish.

This shit is bananas. Seriously tons of banana and tropical fruit as soon as you pop the top. Followed by sweet malt and a bit of citrus. Taste is just insane. Tons of tropical fruit, more banana and grapefruit. Balanced off by a nice malt but not too much. Super good beer.

"also from a can...pours like a bright, fresh ipa. highly aromatic hops, slightly thicker and sweeter mouthfeel and flavor. Oskar states it¬ís a cross between an imperial ipa, strong ale, and amber, and i can see that, although i¬íd definitely class it as an imperial ipa. very hoppy, and very good with a maltier backbone than expected. Man...that¬ís good! gotta downgrade just a tad as i hadn¬ít had a fresh one in a while, and when i finally did, it was a bit of a letdown."

Nice, balanced aroma with sweet bread/malt/caramel, pine, citrus, and citrus. Flavor is a little milder than I expected, slightly sweet and nutty. Strong, fruity, bitter finish. More of an IPA than anything else, but different from most of the double IPAs out there, and in a good way.
Can. Pour reddish copper with a thin white head. Aroma and taste of floral and citrus hops with a caramel hop sweetness. Very nice.

My thoughts of a typically IPA, Def. fruity, and strong alcohol content, 8.7

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted this brew at the Tasty Weasel, which is Oskar Blues Brewery tasting room, located in Longmont, CO. Great hop nose and edge upon tasting that was quenched by the malts, resulting in an unexpectedly balanced finish. This is great beer. A growler of the brew came home with us.
Smell of juicy fruit, appearance is deep amber, taste is nice fruit with earthy rye and a slight bitter finish

Tap @ Oskar Blues. A nice warm up on a cold day. Never had this brew of theirs before so I tried it out on a stop through town on vacation. Not too sweet, nice moderate hop character. Going down easy.
An aroma of malt, rye and a trace of hops. Reddish amber color with a lasting creamy off white head. Sweet malt taste with grains, rye, and traces of hops. An oily feel with a sweet malt finish.

Very hoppy! This is actually a bit more than I at the time could handle. Great aroma, which really gave me the right expectations, but the taste was as I said a bit more than I could take. Insanely bitter, with character of red apples and some dry floral stuff.

Served on cask at Al¬ís of Hampden into a nonic pint.


A - Pours a hazy light brown with a small one finger white head that leaves light lacing down the glass.


S - Fragrant piney hops give it a grassy, leafy, aroma that helps to balance the sweetness from the caramel malts. A hint of the alcohol hides well but is present. A preview of things to come if there ever was one.


T - Huge sweetness from the malt right off the bat. The piney hops pick up where the sweetness left off. Hop flavors are similar to the nose with the addition of citrus fruits such as orange, lemon, and grapefruit. Alcohol is hidden well but is present in the finish. The bitterness from the hops are a welcome addition to this overly sweet offering.


M - Medium body with a medium-heavy flavor thanks to all the sweetness. Good carbonation. Fairly smooth with a sticky sweet finish.


D - I enjoyed this one quite a bit but the huge amounts of sweetness knocks it down a few notches. A good offering from the kings of cans.
Pint from a growler. Transparent red with a thick off white head. Aroma is caramel, citrus, grass, and spices. Heavy malts, citrus hops, grapefruit, pine. Sticky finish. Lingering bitterness.

Can. Pours a hazy dark reddy colour. Nice fresh trop fruit, grassy hoppiness. Medium body, medium carbonation. Caramel, juicy trop fruit, lemon, fruit loaf... Sticky, but balanced and tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can @ home, thx Vaiz. Aroma is big and bold fruity, piney and light herbal hops, some caramel malt notes. Flavour is big and malty with lightly burned caramel at first, then fruity hops with building bitterness, then more burned caramel. Hefty but very nice.

Can from Total Wine, Summerlin. Almost clear orange pour, thin off-white head. Aroma is fruity, sweaty, slightly floral, caramel and grapefruit. Flavor is quite bitter, fruity and with a thick body. Heavy brew.

Pour is rusty orange with lasting thick beige head. Aroma is punchy. Buckets of pine and caramel malt. Hops are oppressed but can be found if you delve. Peach, some apricot and orange. Thick, sticky mouth-feel; indicative of a lot of OB beers. Lots of pine, a hint of grapefruit initially. Fairly sweet actually. Malt consumes quickly. Toffee, burnt sugar and some cracker flavors. Medicinal honey, maybe jam on the back palate. Piney bitterness. Very nice but a little one-paced.
Can at the Rake. Aroma is strawberry jam, bit spiky. Fill bodied but jammy sweetness was good. Light spikiness. Good stuff. JAM TARTS!

On tap at the Kalamazoo Beer Exchange. Pours a clear, deep amber with a creamy head. That laces. Aroma has slight tropical hops and not a lot else. Taste is a medium bitter. Can¬ít really get a lot off of it. Medium body and carbonation. A bit of a strong taste and mild alcohol warmth.
on tap at Black Sheep..amber pour with fluffy white head..aroma of citrus,hops..crisp,dry taste..really good.

On tap at the Brevard tasting room. It?s like Gordon?s with some sweet and tart pomegranate surprise. Soft carbonation, nice malty IPA with fruit addition, no complaints.Earlier Rating: 5/18/2012 Total Score: 4.1Pours a dark copper color on tap with decent off white head and good lacing. Smell is malty sweet, almost like copper and rye, with a decent hop characteristic too. Taste follows smell; very well balanced with a slight alcoholic bite on the back end. Superb, delicious, amazing.

On tap at the Brevard, NC brewery, this pours a hazy walnut-amber into the glass with a huge retentive eggshell head. The nose has sourdough, malts and nice floral hops. Thick caramel, pomegranate citrus, sourdough breadiness and finishes piney, bitter and lightly alcoholic. The full body is super easy to drink via the cask conditioning. Great quaff!Earlier Rating: 10/12/2008 Total Score: 3.9Nice brew.... however reminiscent of their "Dale‚Äôs Pale Ale" offering.  Pours slightly hazed, deep amber into the glass, with an initial eggshell head that leaves wonderful lace.  Spot on for grapefruit and pine needle notes in the bouquet.  Nicely dry-hopped (and bittered so) throughout the pull, the malts are a little underdone for an Impy IPA, but there comes a great caramel and citrusy grapefruit in the flavor, backed with a huge dry pine finish.  Very crisp and clean, I still have to ponder how much this seems like an Impy "Dale‚Äôs PA".... but congratulate the brewer for being smart in the description, and I won‚Äôt fault the rating as such.

Not bad but not quite what I was looking for after a nice plate of rice and black beans, carne asada, plantains, etc. Pretty much your stereotypical malt heavy double IPA (or strong ale whatever). Big doughy chewy caramel malts, seasoned heavily with resiny hops that hint at grapefruit in the nose. Long piney grapefruit rind finish, almost tannic. Heavy body.
Amber with lasting thick white head. Hoppy, caramel, dry hoppy, citrus, biscuit malt aroma. Medium-high mouth feel with high warmth. Hoppy with caramel, toffee, grainy, malt flavors. Crisp and dry.

Draught at BrewDog, Shepherd¬ís Bush on 23 July. Poured a hazy deep amber, with a dense off white head and good lacing. Aroma was herbal, with caramel and rich fruits. Aniseed in the flavour, with rich toffee and some fruity hops. Finish was biscuit, burnt sugar and some roasted character.
16oz can. Copper, cloudy. Aroma of caramel malts, floral hops. Flavor is sweet hoppy resin, big caramel malt in the middle, and a full bodied, sticky palate. A fantastic ASA. RIP Gordon Knight...

Pours amber with a thick off white head. Hop, caramel, resin, citrus, toffee, biscuit and malt aroma. Hop, citrus, resin, caramel, toffee, biscuit and malt flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a slightly dry caramel and hop finish.

Can from Bottledog. Pours a clear amber with a medium brownish white head. Nose is all the best of american hops with lots of pine and citrus. Taste follows suit with a caramel body and hints of berries. Will visit Colorado some day because of this.
can. Fantastic beer - tons of unique flavor that packs a punch. Could have several of these - big fan

47cl. Can. 
Pours clear amber red with tiny white head. 
Aroma pine, grass, citrus, caramel, citrus fruits, earthy. 
Taste malty caramel sweets, piny earthy bitter. 
Mouthfeel sticky, oily. 
Amazing beer!
Tjusigt r√∂dbrun och en aning grumlig. Fyllig och intensiv smak. Viss fruktighet och beska. Mycket drickbar.

From can at home. Pours dark caramel reddish with a offwhite head. Smells of caramel, citrus and hay. Tastes very caramel malty, medium to high bitterness. Tastes some kind of sweet, but not too much. Well balanced!
Draft. Little head with low carbonation. Smooth taste, hides alcohol dangerously well, you¬íd think is beer was 5% or so. Malty with caramel and dark fruit notes. Really excellent.
16oz can pours a red amber with nice head and lacing. Heavy malt aromas balanced with citrus, floral, and caramel. TYMIHA!

Big blootering red number. Serious malt contender, with the thankful backup of that tropical funk punch to the nose. Does this smell of cauliflower a little? I¬ím getting a real vegetal front end here. Yep cauliflower cheese. 
Palate is rich and creamy, with a great spice note aided by fine carbonation. 
Taste is straight up tropical cheese fruit. Mineral maltiness to follow. Lovely balanced tail, not too dry or bitter at all despite the massive hop profile. 
This one is in the top 2-3 imperial IPAs I¬íve had, of any colour.

Can @ Westerpark, Amsterdam.
Red copper, misty head.
Toffee nose and flavour. Huge resin hop presence. Dangerous....
@Westerpark, flown in by jur, wow! Great red colour , awesome hoppy taste. Little sticky aftertaste.

Transfer from BA review from 6-20-12 - 
Served on tap in a 10 oz chalice glass

Appearance ¬ñ Served an amber red color with a thin off white head. The head faded fast to leave a moderate amount of lacing.

Smell ¬ñ The smell was a wonderful balance of sweet tropical fruit (mango, pineapple and a lighter peach) and malt mixed with some citrus and floral hop aromas. Overall very balanced.

Taste ¬ñ The taste as was the nose was- very balanced. It started out on the sweeter side with a good deal of tropical fruit and some bready features. These are quickly meet with some hop flavors of citrus nature. As the taste moves on and the sweetness fades a bit, one is left with a hoppy citrus, pine and grassy hop flavor on the tongue. 

Mouthfeel ¬ñ The body is quite creamy with the carbonation level on the lover side. Both really help to accentuate the sweeter and hoppy flavors of the beer and suit it quite well.

Overall ¬ñ A delicious and very enjoyable red IPA. It has flavor, aroma and feel in a very balanced manner. A wonderful brew and definitely one to try.

This is truly a great Beer. Oskar Blues takes pride in the beers they produce, and it shows. This is a smooth, clean beer, with great character, balance, and hop finish. It is as enjoyable on a cold winter night, as a hot summers day. This beer has toasty, caramel, and biscuit flavors. A great red hue, and a really sweet and crisp finish. I could drink this all day, which makes it very drinkable.
Can at home. Pours reddish brown, burnt toffee, caramel nose, sweet and malty, dry and bitter.
Dark amber with a nice head. Aroma is woody and sweet. Medium in body with good carbonation. Flavor is a bit bitter for my taste, but there is a good amount of malty sweetness.
Dark amber pour on tap. Grain smelling. Taste is creamy dankness. Good amount of hop bitterness. Very tasty.

Can. Translucent red with a thick off white head. Aroma is resinous with pine and sweet fruity malt. Taste adds some tropical fruit, bready malt and substantial alcohol burn. Lots of different things going on here but they're all subtle enough that it's not overwhelming. Mouthfeel is surprisingly soft with little carb. Pretty good.
Blackberry/hop aroma. Fruity taste; blackberries, prunes, raisins. Almost has an iced tea character to it. Medium bitter aftertaste. Overall very flavorful and pleasant. ---Rated via Beer Buddy
Can. Pours amber medium tan head. Nice floral hop aroma with some caramel malt. Medium sweet taste. Medium bitter finish, medium body, sticky mouthfeel. Overall a great strong ale.

Pours a slightly hazy reddish copper color with an ecru head that settles to a dollop and leaves excellent lacing. Aroma of biscuit and cookie malt sweetness, along with floral and citrus hops. Sweet toffee in taste, followed by some bread crust and citrus and herbal hops that hint at being spicy in the aftertaste. Has a soft bitterness. Finishes somewhat sticky with mild bitterness and graininess. Mouthfeel is semi creamy with a medium/full body and moderate carbonation. Was surprised how much I liked this. Wasn¬ít sure what to expect but it was very balanced and flavorful.
Keg @ Brewdog Birmingham. Pours a rusty orange, with swirling sweet complexities and a resinous sticky pine backbone. Syrupy mouthfeel and lots of tangerine with a fair bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2014 Keg at Brewdog Shepherd¬ís Bush. Hazy red / orange, small foamy head. Aroma - caramel, resin. Body - medium, spritzy. Taste - sweet caramel, blackpool rock. Nice if you like very sweet beers¬Öwhich I do from time to time.

Tap at Brewdog Birmingham. Poured a clear dark amber with a thin light tan head and some broken lace. The aroma is malt, light resin hop. The flavour is strong bitter with a huge woody resin hop, light toothpaste mint palate and a long bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. A big kick to this one and it certainly makes a statement!
Can. Dark amber body with light tan head. Aroma is malty with herbs. Taste is smooth and roasted maltys. Aftertaste is medium bitter with some red malts. Very nice one.

This is one hell of a beer with a great balance between malts and hops.
The citrus aroma and color are nice.

2014 can to a pint glass. Pours a hazy light copper color with a thick, rich off-white head. Aroma is light malt with big citrus and pine and a little caramel. Taste is caramel, herbal spice, mango, and a big pine/grass bitterness with some bite. The bitterness ramps up during drinking but doesn't wreck your palate, just slightly lingers. Malt and hops are very well balanced. Has a medium, soft and rounded mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can - red amber, clear with a big off-white head. Aroma is nice balance of hops and caramel malts. Dry hoppy flavour, some pine, sweet then bitter. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Very nice.

Can shared with wyzzywyz22, cheers mate! Poured a copper colour with a decent beige head. Aroma is lovely and hoppy, some toffee and caramel. Flavour is similar, lots of lovely hops, alcohol is well hidden. It¬ís got the lot! Stunning beer.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2014 Can pour. Clean brick red in glass with soft, full head. Aroma is a nice balance between caramel malts and grassy hops. Hint of citric brightness and cheese. Full, but restrained. Taste is hop forward (pine cones, grapefruit, and vague tropic fruit), but balanced nicely by butterscotch malts. The dry hopping shows well and lingers on finish. A pleasant bitter stays on too. Good carbonation. Highly enjoyed and easy to down. No sign of high ABV.

Pours clear amber with foamy white head. Nose is hoppy pine, citrus notes and some caramel malts. Body is mid-range, some carbonation. Sweetness with nice drying finish. Very smooth and refreshing. Great beer.

Notes from 8/2013 - Poured from a 16 oz can to a porter glass, canned 9/18/2013.

A - 4.0 - This is a great looking beer. Super dark orange/reddish color but at the same time very clear. Off white head dissipates down to a thick film that leaves a nice wholesome lacing on the glass.

S - 10 - The smell is basically perfect - super hoppy with sweet grapefruit, citrus, mango, pineapple, and piney smell. Sweet malt in the background leaning more towards caramel rather than bready. It smells so fresh and good, probably the best smelling can of this that I¬íve had.

T - 9 - The taste is basically the same as the smell, like a nice, sweet citrus juice. The hops are so citrusy - with mango, papaya, pineapple, orange juice. The malt is so sweet with a nice caramely/sugary taste in the background. Sooo sweet, but not too sweet.

M - 5 - Great mouthfeel, light - medium. Alc completely covered. Aftertaste is sweet/slightly bitter with orange juice type flavor.

O - 18/20 - This is a great beer.

16oz can.
Pours a slightly hazy deep amber, with an off-white head.
Hoppy, resiny aroma, spruce, caramel, apricot, orange peel, marmalade, bergamot.

COD 1/7/14. Pours a clear amber with a dark ruby hue. Massive head with excellent lacing that has an equal level of retention. Nice nose of sweet citrus (mango and orange) with a touch of pine and grapefruit over a rich caramel malt base. Medium bodied with a creamy texture at a normal level of carbonation.
